election_record.label: Massachusetts 1808 Governor

overview.note: As plantations were not taxed, there was considerable controversy over whether votes from citizens living on plantations would be counted. A number of plantations did not have their votes included in the Original Election Returns, though they were listed in the Returns on a separate sheet.

sub_unit.name: Mount Washington
sub_unit.note: "Return informal." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Mount Washington were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: "Return informal." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Windsor were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Freeport
sub_unit.note: "The facts respecting the Freeport and Pownal votes are these. - Pownal was a part of Freeport, and incorporated as a town the last session of the General Court: But the act of incorporation did not reach the inhabitants in season to allow them to choose selectmen, and be organized as a town, previous to the Governor election in April. - After a consultation in Pownal, they agreed to go to their parent town, Freeport; and request permission to vote in their place of meeting, and that the Selectmen and Town Clerk of Freeport, would certify their numbers. - This was done. - After the electors of Freeport had given in their votes, and the same had been counted, declared certified and sealed up, the electors of Pownal came forward, and gave in their votes; which were counted, declared, certified, and sealed up, by the Selectmen, etc. of Freeport, as votes of Freeport, (Pownal not yet existing as a town;) - and transmitted to the Secretary of State under a cover, on which was written, 'Votes for Governor, etc. for that part of Freeport, lately set off by the name of Pownal; but as they were not duly organized soon enough to vote by themselves, they voted with the town of Freeport, and their votes are here enclosed by themselves to be transmitted to the Secretary of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.' The votes of Freeport were indorsed as usual 'Votes for Governor, etc. for the town of Freeport, County of Cumberland, to be transmitted to the Secretary of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.' These covers were broken open by the Governor and Council. - Both returns were stated as the votes for Freeport; and being separated from the covers, when they came before the Committee, it was found impossible to determine which returns was that stated to be from Freeport and which the votes 'of that part of Freeport lately set off by the name of Pownal,' etc. This fact was only known to the Governor and Council - and the Committee not feeling themselves authorized to inquire of the Governor and Council which returns belong to each cover; the votes were rejected. It will be seen there were a federal majority in each town." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.name: Pownal
sub_unit.note: See Freeport.

sub_unit.name: Thompson Pond Plantation
sub_unit.note: Listed among the plantations whose votes were not included in the official results in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Marblehead
sub_unit.note: "Day of the month and year and name of the town omitted." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Marblehead were rejected.

"The return guessed at as being sent from Marblehead, began in these words: - 'At a legal meeting of the inhabitants of the town of (Blank), county of (Blank), held on the (Blank), day of (Blank), in the year (Blank), the following persons were then voted for.' [Here the votes are enumerated.] The return is then signed by seven names, but nothing was added to shew whether they were selectmen, or a committee of a Caucus." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.name: Middleton
sub_unit.note: "Not returned in Season. Selectman not designated." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Middleton were rejected.

"The votes from, Middleton, South Brimfield, Holland and Readfield, were not return into the Secretary's Office until after the 8th of May; the Constitution required that they should be returned at least 17 days before the last Wednesday of May." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.name: Holland
sub_unit.note: "Selectman not designated and returned too late." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Holland were rejected.

"The votes from, Middleton, South Brimfield, Holland and Readfield, were not return into the Secretary's Office until after the 8th of May; the Constitution required that they should be returned at least 17 days before the last Wednesday of May." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.name: Leverett
sub_unit.note: "No return." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Leverett were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Pelham
sub_unit.note: "Not returned in Season. Selectman not designated." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Pelham were rejected.
"The votes of Pelham, Russell and Northbridge, were not signed by Selectmen, designated as such." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.name: Russell
sub_unit.note: "Selectmen not designated." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Russell were rejected.
"The votes of Pelham, Russell and Northbridge, were not signed by Selectmen, designated as such." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.name: South Brimfield
sub_unit.note: "Not returned in Season." Original Election Returns.
The votes from South Brimfield were rejected.

"The votes from, Middleton, South Brimfield, Holland and Readfield, were not return into the Secretary's Office until after the 8th of May; the Constitution required that they should be returned at least 17 days before the last Wednesday of May." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.name: Eddington Plantation
sub_unit.note: Listed among the plantations whose votes were not included in the official results in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Plantation No. 3
sub_unit.note: Listed among the plantations whose votes were not included in the official results in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Freeman
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Freeman.
Freeman became a town March 4, 1808..

sub_unit.name: New Portland Plantation
sub_unit.note: Listed among the plantations whose votes were not included in the official results in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Readfield
sub_unit.note: "Selectman not designated and returned too late." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Readfield were rejected.

"The votes from, Middleton, South Brimfield, Holland and Readfield, were not return into the Secretary's Office until after the 8th of May; the Constitution required that they should be returned at least 17 days before the last Wednesday of May." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.note: Listed among the plantations whose votes were not included in the official results in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.note: Listed among the plantations whose votes were not included in the official results in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.note: Listed among the plantations whose votes were not included in the official results in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Denmark
sub_unit.note: "Selectman not designated and returned too late." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Denmark were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Newry
sub_unit.note: "Selectman not designated and returned too late." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Newry were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Cherryfield Plantation
sub_unit.note: Listed among the plantations whose votes were not included in the official results in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Plantation No. 8 and 9
sub_unit.note: Listed among the plantations whose votes were not included in the official results in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Fitchburg
sub_unit.note: "Not signed by town clerk." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Fitchburg were rejected.
"The Fitchburg votes were not attested by the Town Clerk." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.name: Northbridge
sub_unit.note: "Selectman not designated" Original Election Returns.
The votes from Northbridge were rejected.
"The votes of Pelham, Russell and Northbridge, were not signed by Selectmen, designated as such." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.

sub_unit.name: Spencer
sub_unit.note: "Return informal." Original Election Returns.
The votes from Spencer were rejected.
"The return from Spencer did not specify that the electors were notified to meet for the choice of Governor and Lt. Governor." Hampshire Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 9, 1808.
